# Knights of the Southern Cross

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

This article is about the organisation in Australia. For the organisation in
New Zealand, see [Knights of the Southern Cross (New
Zealand)](/wiki/Knights_of_the_Southern_Cross_\(New_Zealand\) "Knights of the
Southern Cross \(New Zealand\)").

Knights of the Southern Cross [![Knights of the Southern Cross
\(Australia\).png](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/6e/Knights_of_the_Southern_Cross_%28Australia%29.png/150px-
Knights_of_the_Southern_Cross_%28Australia%29.png)](/wiki/File:Knights_of_the_Southern_Cross_\(Australia\).png)  
---  
Abbreviation | KSC  
Formation | 1919  
Type | Catholic [fraternal](/wiki/Fraternal_and_service_organizations "Fraternal and service organizations") [service](/wiki/Volunteering "Volunteering")  
Headquarters | PO Box 216, [Campbell, ACT](/wiki/Campbell,_ACT "Campbell, ACT"), Australia, 2612  
Supreme Knight | Brian Cooper  
Key people | [Patrick Minahan](/wiki/Patrick_Minahan "Patrick Minahan") and Joseph Lynch  
Website | [ksca.org.au](http://www.ksca.org.au/)  
  
The **Knights of the Southern Cross** (**KSC**) is a Catholic fraternal order
committed to promoting the Christian way of life throughout Australia.

The Order was founded in Sydney in 1919 with the approval of the [Catholic
Bishops](/wiki/Bishop_\(Catholic_Church\) "Bishop \(Catholic Church\)") of
Australia. In 1922 it merged with its Victorian counterpart the [Knights of
St. Francis
Xavier](/w/index.php?title=Knights_of_St._Francis_Xavier&action=edit&redlink=1
"Knights of St. Francis Xavier \(page does not exist\)").[1]

Branches operate in many Catholic Parishes throughout Australia and membership
is open to Catholic men over the age of 18.

St. [Mary MacKillop](/wiki/Mary_MacKillop "Mary MacKillop") is [patron
saint](/wiki/Patron_saint "Patron saint") of the Knights of the Southern
Cross.

The order also established the non-profit aged care organisation, Southern
Cross Care.

## Contents

[hide]

  * 1 The objects of the order
  * 2 History
  * 3 International Alliance of Catholic Knights
  * 4 Notes and references
  * 5 External links

## The objects of the
order[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Knights_of_the_Southern_Cross&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: The objects of the order")]

  * To promote the advancement of Australia
  * To foster the Christian way of life throughout the nation
  * To promote the welfare of members of the Order and their families
  * To encourage spiritual, social and intellectual activities amongst members of the Order
  * To conduct and support educational, charitable, religious and social welfare work

##
History[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Knights_of_the_Southern_Cross&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: History")]

The Order was founded in 1919 in [Sydney](/wiki/Sydney "Sydney") at a time
when Catholics were regarded with suspicion by the
[Protestant](/wiki/Protestant "Protestant") majority in Australia.[2] The two
co-founders were [Patrick Minahan](/wiki/Patrick_Minahan "Patrick Minahan"), a
boot manufacturer and member of the [NSW Legislative
Assembly](/wiki/NSW_Legislative_Assembly "NSW Legislative Assembly"), and
Joseph Lynch, a school inspector.[3] Within a year of its establishment over
1,000 men had joined the order from every state in Australia and a national
council was established to oversee the organisation.[2]

In the beginning it served to assist Catholic [servicemen](/wiki/Servicemen
"Servicemen") returned from the [First World War](/wiki/First_World_War "First
World War") in finding employment, and also to defend the rights and interests
of the Catholic Church in Australia – a mission which it continues to promote
today.[4]

## International Alliance of Catholic
Knights[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Knights_of_the_Southern_Cross&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: International Alliance of Catholic Knights")]

Through the [International Alliance of Catholic
Knights](/wiki/International_Alliance_of_Catholic_Knights "International
Alliance of Catholic Knights"), the Knights of the Southern Cross are
associated with the [Knights of Columbus](/wiki/Knights_of_Columbus "Knights
of Columbus"), the [Knights of St
Columbanus](/wiki/Knights_of_Saint_Columbanus "Knights of Saint Columbanus"),
the [Knights of Da Gama](/wiki/Knights_of_Da_Gama "Knights of Da Gama"), the
[Knights of Peter Claver](/wiki/Knights_of_Peter_Claver "Knights of Peter
Claver"), the [Knights of the Southern Cross (New
Zealand)](/wiki/Knights_of_the_Southern_Cross_\(New_Zealand\) "Knights of the
Southern Cross \(New Zealand\)") and the [Knights of Saint
Columba](/wiki/Knights_of_Saint_Columba "Knights of Saint Columba").
